definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half

sentences.english: I stared at the bushes for a moment without seeing anything.
sentences.chinese: 我往那叢荊棘裏盯了老半天，卻什麼也沒看見。

sentences.english: She conked off for a long time after supper.
sentences.chinese: 她在晚飯後睡了老半天。

sentences.english: It is long and deep, so it will take you a long while to walk patiently and quietly through it from end to end.
sentences.chinese: 它又深又長，一個人耐心靜靜走去，要老半天才走完。

sentences.english: Mybe it would spend you a whole day for waiting.
sentences.chinese: 也許這一等，得花上老半天功夫。

sentences.english: It'll probably take ages to find a parking space.
sentences.chinese: 大概得老半天才能找到停車位。

sentences.english: We conversed for a long while on the phone.
sentences.chinese: 我們在電話裏聊了老半天。

definition: half of the day/a long time/quite a while/midair/CL:個|个[ge4]
half of the day/a long time/quite a while
half the day/a long time/quite a while
(idiomatic usage) with great difficulty/to have a hard time (convincing sb, relinquishing sth etc)/(literal usage) so easy
a moment/a while/in a moment/now...now.../also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]
a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
